en: Route maps with details of Battle of Bulge, Ruhr Pocket, and Drive into Austria

III Corps Reference -- Wiltz River (Belgium and Luxembourg)

body.value: Inset of the Battle of the Bulge (here labelled "Von Runsteds [sic] Winter Offensive". Notes that "American Units Surrounded by the Germans in Bastogne." Also marks the Siegfried Line

Key for "III Corps Reference" map, including the insignia for III Corps.  Notes that "these enlargements were taken from Sheet 1 to show in more detail the action taken by the corps in its three major battles." This appears to refer to the "III Corps Campaigns" map in this collection.  The three battles are the Battle of the Bulge, the Roer/Ruhr Campaign, and the Drive to the Austrian Border.
Advance of III Corps across the Roer and Rhine, including the crossing at Remagen, the Edersee Dam, and the seizure of Bonn
Second half of this section of the map. Depicts III Corps's turn to the north and into the Ruhr Pocket.
First part of the depiction of the drive south through Bavaria toward the Austrian border

The end of the war and the beginning of the occupation for III Corps, including the drive into southern Bavaria and Austria. Caption reading "Combination bridge and dam siezed [sic] by 14th Armored Division May 2. Corps ordered to halt on Inn River 2nd May by Third US Army."

seo.title: III Corps Reference - World War II Service Maps
